name: Asthma
symptoms: Wheezing: A high-pitched whistling sound when breathing out.
Coughing: A dry, persistent cough, especially at night or early in the morning.
Shortness of Breath: Feeling like you can't catch your breath or feel winded.
Chest Tightness: Feeling like there's a band or tightness around your chest.
Rapid Breathing: Breathing faster than normal.
preventive_measures: Avoid Triggers: Allergens, irritants, and respiratory infections.
Use Medications as Prescribed: Controller and quick-relief meds.
Monitor Symptoms: Adjust treatment based on symptoms.
Exercise Regularly: Avoid triggers during activity.
Get Enough Sleep: Helps immune regulation.
Manage Stress: Meditation, yoga, or hobbies.
Manage Exacerbations: Create a plan with your doctor.
Vaccinations: Get flu and pneumonia vaccines.
Allergy Control: Work with your doctor for allergy care.
tips: Keep an Asthma Diary: Track symptoms, triggers, and meds.
Stay Organized: Meds, appointments, and tests.
Seek Support: Join asthma support groups.

name: Cancer
preventive_measures: Healthy Diet: More fruits/vegetables, less processed meat.
Avoid Tobacco: Leading preventable cancer cause.
Protect from Sun: Wear sunscreen and hats.
Get Screened: Early detection saves lives.
complication_prevention: Follow-Up Care: Regular visits after treatment.
Manage Side Effects: Talk to doctors about meds and nutrition.
Mental Health Support: Counseling or therapy.
tips: Stay Informed: Understand your type and treatment.
Build a Support Network: Talk to others who’ve been through it.
Keep a Health Journal: Track side effects, appointments, etc.

name: Pneumonia
symptoms: Chest pain when breathing or coughing
preventive_measures: Get vaccinated: Pneumococcal and flu vaccines.
Avoid smoking: Increases the risk of lung infections.
Avoid close contact with infected individuals.
Wear a mask in crowded places.
complication_prevention: Monitor oxygen levels: To avoid breathing complications.
Follow prescribed antibiotics: Complete the full course.
Stay hydrated: Helps in recovery and fights fever.
tips: Rest often: Rest helps to heal your body faster.
Stay hydrated: Drink fluids regularly to thin mucus.
Seek medical help: If symptoms worsen or new ones develop.

name: Diabetic
preventive_measures: Maintain a healthy weight: Balanced diet and exercise.
Monitor blood sugar levels: Regular testing.
Exercise regularly: Helps control blood sugar levels.
Eat a balanced diet: Focus on fiber-rich foods.
Limit alcohol: Moderation can help avoid blood sugar spikes.
complication_prevention: Manage blood pressure: Helps reduce the risk of complications.
Regular eye exams: To prevent diabetic retinopathy.
Foot care: Regular checks for sores and cuts.
tips: Educate yourself: Learn about diabetes management.
Stay active: Exercise helps control blood sugar.
Track your progress: Keep a log of your meals and blood sugar levels.

name: Heart Disease
symptoms: Pain in neck, back, jaw, or stomach
preventive_measures: Eat a heart-healthy diet: Focus on fruits, vegetables, and whole grains.
Exercise regularly: At least 30 minutes of moderate activity.
Quit smoking: Smoking increases the risk of heart disease.
Limit alcohol: Excessive drinking can increase risk.
complication_prevention: Regular check-ups: Monitor blood pressure and cholesterol.
Stay on prescribed medications: Take blood pressure medications as directed.
Adopt a low-sodium diet: Helps reduce blood pressure.
tips: Know your numbers: Keep track of cholesterol, blood pressure, and blood sugar.
Stay active: Exercise strengthens your heart.
Avoid stress: Practice mindfulness and deep breathing.

name: Kidney Disease
symptoms: Swelling in ankles, feet, or face
preventive_measures: Stay hydrated: Drinking water supports kidney function.
Monitor blood sugar: Prevent diabetes-related kidney damage.
Limit salt intake: Too much salt damages kidneys.
Avoid excessive painkillers: Some medications can harm kidneys.
Get regular kidney check-ups: Especially if at risk.
complication_prevention: Control blood pressure: High blood pressure accelerates kidney damage.
Monitor kidney function: Regular blood tests.
Follow treatment plans: Medications for controlling diabetes or hypertension.
tips: Avoid smoking: Smoking damages kidney function.
Maintain a healthy weight: Reduces strain on the kidneys.
Exercise regularly: Helps in overall health management.

name: Liver Disease
symptoms: Yellowing of the skin or eyes (jaundice)
preventive_measures: Limit alcohol intake: Excessive drinking leads to liver damage.
Get vaccinated: Hepatitis vaccines help prevent liver infections.
Eat a healthy diet: Focus on fruits, vegetables, and lean proteins.
Avoid exposure to toxins: Avoid contaminated food and water.
Control body weight: Reduces fat buildup in the liver.
complication_prevention: Follow a liver-healthy diet: Reduce fat intake.
Avoid alcohol: Essential for liver disease management.
Take medications as prescribed: Prevent further damage.
tips: Monitor liver health: Regular check-ups and liver function tests.
Stay hydrated: Water helps to flush out toxins.
Limit sugar and fat intake: Supports liver detoxification.

name: HIV/AIDS
preventive_measures: Practice safe sex: Use condoms to prevent transmission.
Get tested regularly: Early detection helps in treatment.
Avoid sharing needles: Prevents transmission through blood.
Limit high-risk behaviors: Reduces the chance of exposure.
Take preventive medications: PrEP for those at risk.
complication_prevention: Adhere to antiretroviral therapy: Key to managing HIV.
Monitor CD4 count: Ensures the immune system is functioning.
Prevent opportunistic infections: Regular screenings and vaccinations.
tips: Educate yourself: Know the facts about HIV prevention and treatment.
Maintain a healthy lifestyle: Supports immune function.
Stay connected: Join support groups or therapy for emotional health.

name: Chronic Respiratory Disease
preventive_measures: Quit smoking: Smoking is the leading cause of chronic respiratory disease.
Get vaccinated: Flu and pneumonia vaccines are essential.
Avoid exposure to pollutants: Use air purifiers if needed.
Exercise regularly: Helps strengthen lung capacity.
Stay hydrated: Hydration supports respiratory health.
complication_prevention: Use prescribed inhalers or medications: Helps control symptoms.
Avoid allergens: Reduce exposure to triggers like dust or pollen.
Monitor lung function: Regular check-ups and spirometry tests.
tips: Know your triggers: Track what causes symptoms to worsen.
Practice breathing exercises: Helps improve lung function.
Stay active: Light exercise can help maintain lung health.

name: Diabetes
preventive_measures: Eat Balanced Meals: Control carbs and sugar.
Monitor Blood Sugar: Daily checks are essential.
complication_prevention: Foot Care: Daily checks for wounds or numbness.
Eye Exams: Regular checkups to prevent damage.
Heart Health: Manage BP and cholesterol.
tips: Meal Prep: Plan ahead for better control.
Educate Family: So they can help in emergencies.

preventive_measures: Avoid Raw Vegetables in Unsafe Areas
